intent_atoms.description: Generate fixture files from a manifest that includes remote metadata and license texts.
The generate_fixtures.py script must load the manifest.json file located in Documentation/FixtureCatalog/manifest.json.
The script must stream downloads of fixtures with SHA-256 checksum validation.
License texts for each fixture must be mirrored under Documentation/FixtureCatalog/licenses/.
The script should support a dry-run mode that verifies the manifest without performing actual downloads.
Unit tests must cover successful download scenarios, checksum failures, and dry‑run behavior.
Checksum validation must always succeed for valid fixtures; if it fails, the process should abort.
Fixture metadata is stored in a JSON manifest file under Documentation/FixtureCatalog/manifest.json to keep track of remote resources.
License texts are mirrored in separate folder (… licenses ..).

functional_units.name: generate_fixtures.py
functional_units.description: Loads fixture manifests, streams downloads with SHA-256 validation, mirrors license texts, and supports dry-run verification.

functional_units.name: manifest.json
functional_units.description: Tracks remote fixture metadata and mirrored license texts for fixtures.

functional_units.name: Documentation/FixtureCatalog/licenses/
functional_units.description: Directory containing mirrored license texts for each fixture.

functional_units.name: Tests/test_generate_fixtures_manifest.py
functional_units.description: Unit tests exercising the manifest pipeline via unittest runner.

functional_units.name: Python command to run tests
functional_units.description: Runs all unit tests in Tests directory using python -m unittest.

functional_units.name: Dry-run command
functional_units.description: Executes generate_fixtures.py with skip-text-fixtures, manifest path, and dry-run flag for validation.
